quizzes.question: The "concat" method takes two arrays and:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Combining Arrays[/h1]

JavaScript's [b]concat()[/b] method allows you to join arrays and create an entirely new array.

[b]Example:[/b] [code format="js" codeId="699"]var c1 = ["HTML", "CSS"];
var c2 = ["JS", "C++"];
var [b]courses [/b]= [b]c1.concat(c2)[/b];[/code]
The [b]courses [/b]array that results contains 4 elements (HTML, CSS, JS, C++).
[note]The [b]concat [/b]operation does not affect the [i]c1[/i] and [i]c2[/i] arrays - it returns the resulting concatenation as a new array.[/note]
